item.title: 苹果准备推出配备触摸和打孔屏幕的高端 MacBook Pro
item.description: 苹果公司准备最终推出触摸屏版 Mac 电脑，改变了联合创始人史蒂夫-乔布斯（Steve Jobs）的立场。【原文：Apple Inc. is preparing to finally launch a touch-screen version of its Mac computer, reversing course on a stance that dates back to co-founder Steve Jobs.】

item.title: 以色列中央银行行长希望停火协议更加明确
item.description: 以色列央行行长表示，鉴于美国策划的结束与哈马斯战争的停火协议存在不确定性，决策者在降息问题上将 "非常谨慎"。【原文：Israel’s central bank chief said policymakers will move “very cautiously” on interest-rate cuts given the uncertainty over the US-orchestrated ceasefire deal to end the war with Hamas.】

item.title: 克甘亚戈称美中贸易争端是全球经济的风险所在
item.description: 南非央行行长莱塞特贾-克加亚戈（Lesetja Kganyago）表示，中美贸易紧张局势重燃可能会推低其他国家的物价，从而损害本国制造商的利益。【原文：The renewed trade tensions between the US and China could push prices lower in other countries at the expense of their own manufacturers, South Africa’s central bank governor Lesetja Kganyago said.】

item.title: 777 Partners 联合创始人 Wander 被控诈骗 5 亿美元
item.description: 迈阿密投资公司 777 Partners 的共同创始人乔希-万德（Josh Wander）因涉嫌欺骗公司贷款人和投资者近 5 亿美元而被指控犯有共谋罪和欺诈罪。【原文：Josh Wander, the co-founder of Miami investment firm 777 Partners, was charged with conspiracy and fraud for allegedly cheating lenders and investors in the firm out of almost $500 million.】

item.title: 阿根廷人抛售比索，赌美国救援注定失败
item.description: 阿根廷人深信，即使来自美国的大量现金也无法阻止比索再次痛苦地贬值。【原文：Argentines are convinced that even a flood of cash from the US won’t be able to stop another painful devaluation of the peso.】

item.title: 瑞波支付 10 亿美元收购 GTreasury，进军企业财资领域
item.description: 加密货币公司瑞波（Ripple）表示，已同意以 10 亿美元的价格收购财资管理软件提供商 GTreasury。【原文：Crypto firm Ripple said it has agreed to buy treasury management software provider GTreasury for $1 billion.】

item.title: 美国征收关税有助于将 2025 年赤字削减至 17.8 亿美元
item.description: 由于关税收入创下历史新高，美国 2025 财年的预算赤字略有下降，但在经济扩张和金融稳定时期，借贷速度仍处于历史高位。【原文：The US budget deficit declined slightly for the 2025 fiscal year as tariff revenue hit a record high, though the pace of borrowing remains historically elevated at a time of economic expansion and financial stability.】

item.title: 美国首次公开募股（IPO）候选人有四周时间可供选择，因为关门时间拖长了
item.description: 由于联邦政府停摆、假期和财务报告规则等原因，年底前在美国交易所上市的机会急剧减少，企业面临艰难抉择。【原文：The opportunities to go public on US exchanges by the end of the year have been sharply narrowed by the federal government shutdown, holidays and financial reporting rules, leaving companies facing tough decisions.】

item.title: 甲骨文称利润率可达 35% 缓解对人工智能利润的担忧
item.description: 甲骨文公司（Oracle Corp. ）公布了其大型人工智能基础设施项目的利润率预期，缓解了华尔街对一个重要的新业务部门盈利能力的担忧，之后该公司股价飙升。【原文：Oracle Corp. spiked after sharing its margin expectations for large AI infrastructure projects, easing some of Wall Street’s concerns about the profitability of a crucial new business unit.】

item.title: 盈利疲软引发增长担忧，保险股延续跌势
item.description: 周四，在Marsh & McLennan Cos Inc.、Progressive Corp.和Travelers Cos Inc.发布了疲软的财报后，保险相关公司的股票延续了跌势，给该行业蒙上了一层阴影，并引发了对增长的担忧。【原文：Shares of insurance related companies extended a selloff Thursday, after weak earnings reports from Marsh & McLennan Cos Inc., Progressive Corp. and Travelers Cos Inc. cast a pall over the sector and sparked growth concerns.】

item.title: 大陆集团第三季度因销售组合和成本削减而表现出色
item.description: 德国轮胎制造商大陆股份公司（Continental AG）称，该公司第三季度业绩超出分析师预期，原因是该公司削减了成本，并销售了更多价格较高的产品。【原文：Continental AG said it outperformed analyst expectations in the third quarter after the German tire maker cut costs and sold more of its pricier products.】

item.title: 基金规模增至 570 亿美元，哈佛详述 "充满挑战 "的一年
item.description: 哈佛大学揭示了其与特朗普政府斗争的压力，以及不断上涨的开支所带来的压力，尽管其雄厚的财力有助于缓解这些打击。【原文：Harvard University revealed the strain of its fight with the Trump administration and continued pressure from rising expenses even as its vast financial resources helped cushion the blows.】

item.title: 国债对冲 10 年期收益率低于 4% 可能引发更深反弹
item.description: 交易者对美国国债市场期权的需求正在增加，以防 10 年期国债收益率进一步大幅下跌至 4% 以下，此举可能引发整个债券市场更广泛的反弹。【原文：Demand for options in the US Treasuries market is building up by traders seeking protection against a sharp drop in 10-year bond yields further below 4%, a move that could unleash a broader rally across the bond market.】

item.title: EA 的《战地 6》游戏创下 700 万份的销售记录
item.description: 电子艺界公司（Electronic Arts Inc. ）的新游戏《战地 6》（Battlefield 6）在发售的头三天就售出了 700 多万份，创下了第一人称射击游戏的最高纪录。【原文：Electronic Arts Inc. sold more than seven million copies of its new Battlefield 6 title in the first three days of release, a record for the first-person shooter franchise.】

item.title: 莱恩称欧洲央行决心根据数据决定下一步行动
item.description: 欧洲中央银行首席经济学家菲利普-莱恩（Philip Lane）表示，欧洲中央银行决心恪守承诺，根据最新数据做出政策决定。【原文：The European Central Bank is determined to stick to its commitment to take policy decisions based on data as they arrive, according to Chief Economist Philip Lane.】

item.title: 拉加德称欧洲央行有能力应对未来冲击
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，欧洲央行的借贷成本处于适当水平，可以应对世界经济接下来可能经历的任何动荡。【原文：European Central Bank borrowing costs are at appropriate levels to deal with whatever turbulence the world economy may endure next, President Christine Lagarde said.】

item.title: 中国将贸易紧张局势归咎于美国，警告不要脱钩
item.description: 中国商务部长王文涛周四将最近与美国贸易紧张局势的升级归咎于上个月在马德里举行的最新一轮双边会谈之后美国采取的行动。【原文：China’s Commerce Minister Wang Wentao on Thursday blamed the recent escalation in trade tensions with the US on American actions following the latest bilateral round of talks, in Madrid last month.】

item.title: 美国国家航空航天局领导层候选人包括退休空军军官
item.description: 据熟悉相关讨论的人士透露，退役的美国空军中将约瑟夫-瓜斯特拉（Joseph Guastella）正在被考虑担任美国国家航空航天局（NASA）局长一职，这为争夺局长职位的候选人队伍增添了新的成员。【原文：Retired US Air Force Lieutenant General Joseph Guastella is being considered for the top job at NASA, according to people familiar with the discussions, adding to the pool of candidates in contention for the administrator role.】

item.title: 加纳计划年底前出台加密资产法
item.description: 加纳央行行长约翰逊-阿西亚马（Johnson Asiama）周四在国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）于华盛顿召开的会议间隙表示，加纳预计将在 12 月底之前制定出监管加密货币和虚拟资产的法律。【原文：Ghana expects to have a law to regulate cryptocurrencies and virtual assets in place by the end of December, Johnson Asiama, governor of the West African nation’s central bank, said on the sidelines of the International Monetary Fund’s meetings in Washington on Thursday.】

item.title: Apple TV 与 NBC 的 Peacock 合作提供新的流媒体捆绑服务
item.description: 苹果公司（Apple Inc. ）和康卡斯特公司（Comcast Corp. ）旗下的 NBC 环球公司（NBCUniversal）将联手推出一款新的流媒体捆绑产品，以每月 15 美元的价格提供从 NBA 等直播赛事到 Ted Lasso 等热门特许经营权和大片等广泛内容。【原文：Apple Inc. and Comcast Corp.’s NBCUniversal are teaming up to launch a new streaming bundle that will offer wide-ranging content from live events like the NBA to popular franchises like Ted Lasso and blockbuster movies for $15 a month.】

item.title: 摩根大通 200 亿美元 EA 融资将由各家银行分担
item.description: 在摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）举债 200 亿美元为这一杠杆收购提供资金后，收购电子艺界公司（Electronic Arts Inc.【原文：The consortium buying Electronic Arts Inc. is set to add more than a dozen banks to its underwriting group after JPMorgan Chase & Co. put up $20 billion of debt to bankroll the leveraged buyout.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚承诺在债务改革中延长债券回购期限
item.description: 哥伦比亚公共信贷部主任哈维尔-奎利亚尔（Javier Cuellar）表示，哥伦比亚政府将继续回购主权债券，作为重整国家债务状况战略的一部分。【原文：Colombia’s government will continue repurchasing sovereign bonds as part of a strategy to revamp the country’s debt profile, said Javier Cuellar, the director of public credit.】

item.title: 私人信贷因 "以假乱真 "的研究而再次处于守势
item.description: 一群学者称，私人信贷行业宣称的 "搏击市场、无压力 "的回报是 "虚幻的"，这在高管们已经抵御了杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）等人抨击的一周里，无疑是火上浇油。【原文：The private credit industry’s claims of market-beating, stress-free returns are “illusory,” a group of academics say, adding fuel to the fire in a week that already saw executives fend off broadsides from the likes of Jamie Dimon.】

item.title: 科切尔主张欧洲央行保持冷静，政策处于 "有利位置
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马丁-科切尔（Martin Kocher）认为，鉴于通胀符合其目标，欧洲中央银行应采取冷静的货币政策。【原文：The European Central Bank should take a calm approach to monetary policy, given inflation is in line with its target, according to Governing Council member Martin Kocher.】

item.title: Zions 和 Western Alliance 披露与涉嫌欺诈有关的不良贷款
item.description: 两家美国地区性银行披露了涉及欺诈指控的贷款问题，使人们更加担心借款人的信用正在出现更多裂痕。【原文：Two regional US banks disclosed problems with loans involving allegations of fraud, adding to concern that more cracks are emerging in borrowers’ creditworthiness.】

item.title: 突尼斯拒绝国际货币基金组织后转向中央银行和财富税
item.description: 在拒绝了国际货币基金组织的潜在救助后，突尼斯试图解决日益增长的融资需求，因此计划明年向中央银行贷款约 40 亿美元，同时征收新的财富税。【原文：Tunisia plans to tap the central bank for about $4 billion next year while levying a new wealth tax, as it seeks to tackle rising financing needs after spurning a potential International Monetary Fund bailout.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行关注与收购债务和企业贷款相关的美元 SRT
item.description: 随着西班牙桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）在美国投资银行业务的扩张，该银行正在酝酿与美元收购债务和企业贷款组合相关的重大风险转移。【原文：Banco Santander SA is mulling significant risk transfers tied to portfolios of dollar-denominated buyout debt and corporate loans, as the Spanish lender expands its US investment banking business.】

item.title: 加拿大表示批准美国政府入股矿业公司
item.description: 加拿大能源部长蒂姆-霍奇森（Tim Hodgson）表示，加拿大不太可能反对美国政府投资两家总部位于温哥华的矿业公司，并称这些交易是 "行动中的资本主义"。【原文：Canada is unlikely to object to US government investments in two Vancouver-based mining companies, Energy Minister Tim Hodgson said, describing the deals as “capitalism in action.”】

item.title: 银行卡数据显示美国零售销售疲软，因停摆推迟发布报告
item.description: 与美国官方零售销售报告不同的信用卡数据和其他私营部门数据基本表明，在经历了今年夏天的旺盛消费之后，消费者需求在上个月有所放缓。【原文：Credit-card data and other private-sector alternatives to the official US retail sales report largely suggest consumer demand moderated last month after a vigorous stretch of spending this summer.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织总裁称加拿大有增加资本支出的财政空间
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）总裁表示，加拿大有足够的财政空间来进行提高生产率的投资，并对联邦政府提出的预算时间调整建议表示赞赏。【原文：The head of the International Monetary Fund says Canada has the fiscal room to make productivity-boosting investments, and praised the federal government’s proposed changes to budget timing.】
